definition: ancient bronze wine holder with 3 legs and loop handle/nobility
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: I also would like to make the Jazz Festival in Corporate Woods.
sentences.chinese: 我還想在公司樹林裏舉辦一個爵士音樂節。

sentences.english: The study included six full-time professional jazz musicians.
sentences.chinese: 這項研究包括六位全職的職業爵士音樂家。

sentences.english: The crazy jazzman gazed at the blaze on the razor with amazement.
sentences.chinese: 瘋狂爵士音樂演奏者驚愕地盯着剃刀上白斑。

sentences.english: Jazz music comes from the house, and large amounts of oysters and champagne are served.
sentences.chinese: 豪宅中傳出爵士音樂，還供應大量的生蠔和香檳。

sentences.english: Jack is great on cycling and jazz.
sentences.chinese: 傑克熱衷於騎自行車和聽爵士音樂。

sentences.english: The crazy jazzman gazed at the blaze on the razor with amazement.
sentences.chinese: 瘋狂的爵士音樂演奏者驚愕地盯着剃刀上的白斑。

sentences.english: The white musicians created the foundation for what is now called Dixieland jazz .
sentences.chinese: 這止匕白人樂隊開創了今大所謂南方爵士音樂的先聲。

sentences.english: Yes. I appreciate jazz music, for example.
sentences.chinese: 是哦，舉例來說，我很欣賞爵士音樂。

sentences.english: The crazy jazzman gazed at the blaze on the razor with amazement.
sentences.chinese: 厲害的爵士音樂演奏者驚愕地盯着剃刀上的白斑。

definition: Grammy Award (US prize for music recording)/also written 葛萊美獎|葛莱美奖
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
